number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 4, 2014
												To start off. This game is defenitly different than your average 2D fighter. With a very simular aspect of a Super Smash Bros. game, It's A four-player game with a objective that's not beating up another player until their health gauge is gone. Instead your hitting a ball at intense velocities slowly creeping up in momentum until one of the players hits it back faster or is knocked out by the ball. This is where it gets insane. Each character, despite its low roster, has special abilities to either make the ball move faster or cause insane mix-ups on the other players. They all have simular properties to SSB characters: like fast falling, Dash Dancing, and floaties. The big thing that you need to learn in this game is not really the technical prowess, but learning the frames of the game, predicting where the balls is going to go, and timing every hit correctly. Aside from all this jibber jabber, this game offers minimal stuff to do aside from leveling up, unlocking skins, and comepleting a offline challange mode simular to a arcade mode of somesort. The online takes a while to  find any kind of matches including 1 on 1 or a free for all battle but I have yet to run into a  match where it's just miseriably laggy. If you want a hype, over the top, different 2d fighter game; play this, enjoy it with your friends or go online and smash some scrubs. I'd definintly recommend this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2015
												Lethal League is a super fun, Smash Bros style (not objective wise) game that is extremely fun with friends. Now, if you don't have friends, maybe you shouldn't pick this one up, as the BOTs are fun, but not near as fun as playing with someone you know. While playing with my friend, with other people watching, I heard many "dude that was awesome"s or histarical laughter as someone gets hit by a super easy ball. The gameplay consists of hitting a ball back and forth between 1-3 other players, if you hit the ball last, it is outlined in your color and is lethal if it touches the other player. The other player has to hit the ball back to make it their color and to try and get you. This simple gameplay leads to hilarious moments where people get lucky shots and send the ball back even faster to the next player. The ball speed is really fast and sometimes hard to predict when you first pick up the game, so you can feel a real sense of getting better as you play the game. Super fun game, the AI is good, but not outstanding, pick it up if you have friends to play it with.

												short version: worth the buylong-ish version: great multiplayer game that brings smash bros to mind in it's relatively simple yet chaotic gameplay. the kind of game thats easy to learn and hard to master. characters skills leave a nice twist on the gameplay. awesome soundtrack. art is pretty neat, especially when the ball really gets moving. leveling system unlocks skins, which is nice, but nothing game changhing, obviously. overall just a pretty fun game for fighting game fans looking for something new and different, but i doubt that it would ever be played hardcore mlg like street fighter or tekken. one thing to note, however, is that i DID buy this with 2 friends, so i've been playing with them pretty exclusively; if/when i get around to trying more of the single player or trying random multiplayer i'll update the review, but i wouldn't count on it since i'll probably forget/am incredibly lazy.solid 8/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												How do I describe this game?.......Lethal leauge is how many peopke describe it, a mix between PONG and Super Smash Bros. The main idea is you and up to 3 other players hit a small ball that seems to lack gravity or air resistance inbetween each other. When you hit the ball it get's 'tagged' with your color, and if someone gets hit with the ball when it's not tagged their color they're out.There's a lot more to it than that, like stage sizes and hit angles, but if you want a fun little game you ca jump into whenever and mess around with friends, or compete in actual tournaments, this game is for you.It's also a very chaotic game, however. At times you and someone else will end up getting one of you out, then thinking 'What the hell just happened?' And usually it can be a bit jarrring, especially at higher ball speeds when the screen starts shaking and you have to factor in hit lag.Overall, I give this game a 10/10. Really. I have no complaints.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												How do I describe this game?.......Lethal leauge is how many peopke describe it, a mix between PONG and Super Smash Bros. The main idea is you and up to 3 other players hit a small ball that seems to lack gravity or air resistance inbetween each other. When you hit the ball it get's 'tagged' with your color, and if someone gets hit with the ball when it's not tagged their color they're out.There's a lot more to it than that, like stage sizes and hit angles, but if you want a fun little game you ca jump into whenever and mess around with friends, or compete in actual tournaments, this game is for you.It's also a very chaotic game, however. At times you and someone else will end up getting one of you out, then thinking 'What the hell just happened?' And usually it can be a bit jarrring, especially at higher ball speeds when the screen starts shaking and you have to factor in hit lag.Overall, I give this game a 10/10. Really. I have no complaints.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 28, 2014
												I guess I'll start this review like everyone else started their own review:No weak♥♥♥♥♥♥Lethal League is a projectile fighting game that plays like nothing else I know of. To make immediate comparisons, it's like Smash Bros meets Pong meets Divekick, with a lot of emphasis on the Divekick part. The goal of the game is incredibly simple: hit the ball to gain control of it, try to smack it into everybody else. If someone else hits the ball, don't get hit and try to return the ball.This game is deceptively simple, and I say this because even though the mechanics are limited, the ways in which you use those mechanics are actually fairly deep. You have two main actions you can take, you can hit the ball or you can bunt the ball. When you hit the ball, you can either send it flying straight, or angle it up or down. Bunting the ball will slow it down to its lowest possible speed and pop it in the air, giving you time to place your next hit strategically. Every hit will cause the ball to gain more speed, making it harder to keep track of, dodge, and hit.But it turns out that there's WAY MORE STUFF YOU CAN DO THAN THAT. There are six ways of hitting the ball: on the ground, you can angle it up, down, or straight forward, in the air you can angle it up, forward, or spike it to the ground. Spiking the ball automatically doubles the speed, so you can cause the ball to get faster multiplicatively by spiking it over and over again. You can also bunt the ball up, forward, backward, or straight down, giving you options on where you place the ball. Hitting a ball at the same time as your opponent causes you guys to clash and bounce off each other. And with the five characters, each one has their own super move, swing speeds, swing arcs, and hitting angles. This game hits every fighting game requirement in respect to its depth, but at the same time it has that appeal that Divekick has of being super easy to pick up.The music is amazing in this game, all the tracks are taken from independent music creators, and it sets the entire tone of the game really well. Tracks are intense and fun, matching the frantic gameplay. The sound design isn't shabby either, as the ball increases in speed you hear sonic booms, the hit sounds are really nice and snappy, this game loves to bombard you with its really solid sound design.The art style is really great, too. Well drawn backgrounds that aren't too busy, but are still dynamic and change as the ball moves faster and faster. The characters are really interesting looking and are animated well, and your moves feel like they have weight behind them.As for the online, it works beautifully. Lag is completely unnoticable, when it works it works well. I did have occasional disconnection problems, but it was pretty negligable as me and my friends could jump back into the game really easily if anything went wrong and pick up with a fresh round.The only possible complaint you can levy against this game really is that the content is slightly lacking. With only five characters to choose from and six stages, it might leave you wishing for a little more to play with. But all in all, this game is an incredibly solid mechanical marvel that is great fun with friends. I give this a solid recommendation; there's no reason not to have this in your library.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												If I had to give this game a tagline, it would be "very fun, but really only if you have friends to play with".Really, this game has the potential to be very fun. In the most basic game, you hit a ball back and forth; if it hits you, you're out for the round. And it gains speed at every swing. So pretty simple, really. And hilarious. You can play local multiplayer or online multiplayer, and there's also a single player mode ("challenge mode") which is a set amount of matches against set characters and combinations. The game modes are free-for-all (just hitting the ball until only one player remains), team play (works best for four players, obviously) and strikers (hit the other team's goal instead of its players).The problem with this game is that if you're playing alone, there really isn't much to do besides challenge mode - which, honestly, I didn't find it as fun as multiplayer. You can try to search for matches online, but most of the time it's just unfruitful, and the online mode has quite a few connectivity issues, especially if the match has more than two players. The game also gets repetitive quite fast, and while leveling up does unlock new things, they're mostly skins for the characters (there are 6 different in the game) which are purely cosmetic and honestly not that rewarding.Still, if you have a couple friends willing to engage in some pong-esque shenanigans, maybe over a skype call or even some pizza at your house, I can recommend getting a multi-pack of this game and bash away.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
												Personally i think the game is fantastic to play with friends. I saw videos of people playing it on youtube and loved what i saw. got in and realized... the game is hard, still fun, but hard. the ball goes up to high speeds quicklyso an average game is around 3-4 minutes at 8 lives starting at the default speed. there are a surpriding amount of strategies you can come up with after you figure out the nuances of the characters. my personal favorite is the fact that if you aim up with Switch (the robot skateboarder) the ball goes up and behind you, the hammer girl (Sonata) can change the ball direction with her special, my girlfriend even enjoys playing the aligator (Latch) because she can play "Walligator" by clinging to a wall and swinging until she can grab the ball and shoot it at me point blank. all in all it's a good gamesolid sound tracka "challenge" mode that reminds me of super smash bros classic 1P mode.art style isnt much at first but it grows on youminor connection issues in online multiplayerlocal multiplayer as well as onlineeasy to learn hard to master i would say (a lot of little details that make you better, but arent needed for casual play)-basics  - swing (hit ball, ups speed by 1) [aimable]  - bunt (knock ball up next to hit it gets bonus special meter) [aimable]        - once bunted the ball will move at a low speed but resume previous speed when hit by a player or hitting the ground  - parry (hit bunt during a hit to drain your special and knock back nearby players) [must be trying to hit the ball]  - slam (downward air swing that doubles the speed of the ball)specials and traits-candyman  - ball will teleport to the wall opposite the next wall it collides with keeping speed and direction, refreshed if CM hits it again  - candyman has no heavy falling  - candyman has the sharpest slam angle - sonata  - special hits the ball 3 times after release, can reaim the ball at these points  - has a double jump - latch   - can climb walls   - largest hitbox   - special eats the ball, carries it, and releases at speed it was caught - switch   - can scate on walls and cieling (limited time)   - upward aim goes behind him   - special is activated as a doublejump, if the ball hits switch during his kickflip the ball is hit by switch (counter) - Raptor  - smallest hitbox  - can bunt if ball is above him  - fastest hit  - special hits the ball twice and can change the direction of the ball on release

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												One of the most interesting and inventive nontraditonal fighting games I've seen. Lethal League hides a ton of hardcore competitive depth beneath a deceptively simple and accessible surface. It also does an perfect job of making all the characters' playstyles and matchups feel unique despite the lack of large movesets, instead differentiating them through movement techniques, launch angles, and special mixups. An absolute must-play for both hardcore fighting game fans and casual players too.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2016
												I found this really interesting game on YouTube, and it looked appealing. So I waited for a good sale, bought it, and just had a blast. When I first saw this game, I thought it was your average fighting game that you could land all the sweet combos with friends. But Lethal League is so much more than just a fighting game. With the only way to blast fighters out of the arena using a ball that is consitantly gaining speed, bouncing, flying, and who knows what in any direction, this game adds an intense factor in trying to stay alive.I remember when I had three friends over and we all had out own wired controllers, so I suggested we played Lethal League. I had already been playing a lot of it, and they had never played in their life. Now, when I thought playing alone was fun, I never accounted having friends to play with. But when more people joined the game, it becomes hilariously joyous, with a lot of tense moments of only two people left and the ball being at over 1000 speed, some people figuring out new attacks, or people getting that three-hit wipeout, mostly on accident.All in all, Lethal League is a sweat-inducing and creative game, bringing a fresh idea to the fighting game genre, and one that works incredibly well. The multiplayer works great, hit detection is fine, the characters are interesting, and the gameplay is just plain awesome.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												My favorite local multiplayer / casual fighter game on the market, as I write this.It's simple enough for new players to pick it up and actually have fun immediately, with enough depth and split-second timing to keep things fresh. The mechanics are elegant and well-considered (unlike Divekick), there's some thoughtfulness to the action (more than Samurai Gunn), it's easy to see what's going on, and fun for any level of play (the bad part of Towerfall), and doesn't lend itself to standoffs or ever get slow (Nidhogg). The music is great. It looks bad, but don't let that stop you. Netplay is fairly good (!). My favorite local multiplayer competitive game of 2014.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												Lethal League is pretty unique in the world of fighting games. The focus on a single projectile livens up an old genre with pong-like battle mechanics.Lethal League is also quite easy to pick up. The controls are simple, though there are a number of little tricks to learn, as well as ball trajectories. It will make a great party game, and it's a lot of fun for 2-4 players (the more the merrier IMO, though a good 1 on 1 can be intense).The solo 'challenge' mode is sufficiently challenging, and if that's not enough, you can also hone your skills against hard bots in versus play. As a solo player, you'll likely spend most of your time in online matches. My experience with online play has been good so far, often feeling as good as the local game.The art style is a matter of personal preference. I love it. I also love the way visual effects are tied in with the game's core mechanics, with distortion animations playing when the ball breaks certain speeds.The game's starting roster is small - just 5 characters - but they play quite differently. Some of the differences are obvious, like special attacks, jumps and special movement (like clinging to walls or skateboarding on the ceiling), while other differences are more subtle (like the angles of upwards and downwards strokes). There are rumours of more in the works, and it has been said that new characters will be added to the game in free updates.With all this in mind, Lethal League is a wonderful gem of a game, perfect for people who want something to play with friends, locally and online, and also great for competitive fighting game players looking for new ways to test their skills and reflexes without memorizing long combos.

												GOTY 2014Buy this game.Simple but extremely deep gameplay. Smack a ball between you and up to 3 other people. Each hit it goes faster. Down smash for double speed. Extremely intense and suspensful.Online and offline multiplayer modes. Online uses GGPO and is lag free.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												Lethal League is like a glorified Pong with a Smash Bros. skin. The basic objective is to knock your opponent(s) out using a ball that you keep knocking back and forth in between each other. Sound simple, yeah? But the catch is the more the ball gets smacked around, the faster it goes. Soon enough it reaches insane speeds to where you can barely keep up with it. The enviornment even changes as the speed gets faster and faster.The game is played in "Bursts", or rounds, and the ball's speed resets every round. The use of bursts make every round very intense and heart-pounding when the ball reaches the incredible speeds. Dare I say you may even be on the edge of your seat. The soundtrack is great, too. Definitely fitting for the game, having nice funky tunes with you. Take a listen sometime.The characters are pretty unique in their own right. They each have a distinct character design and personality that you can easily recognize. I'm sure you'll find someone you like. Also, each of them have special abilities that have different effects on the ball, such as Candyman's ability to make the ball phase through the walls.In short, Lethal League is a fast paced, blood pumping action fest that you'll surely get a kick out of. I highly recommend it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 20, 2015
												Lethal League is probably the craziest game I have played to date. The introduction of a projectile in a fighter is absolute genius and works extremely well to my surprise.The goal basically is to hit a baseball around the screen and hope it hits your opponent but after playing a couple of games you are able to start predicting where the ball will go. Player modes include free for all, teams, pvp and multiple opponents. The more players you have the more crazy the game becomes, it’s great!!! I also found we were starting to use teamwork to work combos a lot more, which is a good thing. At the start of each game the player/s can choose a game type and also have the option to tweak ball speed, stock amounts, hit tag on and off and game time limit. I guess this is basicly a customizable hard difficulty but I never found myself using it. This is probably something for the more advanced hardcore players because you can max out the ball speed to hilariously stupid speeds. Try this straght away.The use of the different abilities and the build up of the little bar under your stocks, is extremely satisfying when you pull out a planned play, as if that ever happens. Even though each character has different abilities and some characters abilities are easier to play than others the game still seems balanced while playing. It’s like they have designed the characters based on players skill and it’s easy to see this especially with the layout of the character select when setting up a new game. The game is resolved when there is only one player left with stocks  or if a player has the most stocks at the end of the time limit. Though I found the time limit was unnecessary in most cases because the game usually ends far before the time is up.The games controls are simplistic in the way that there is only a couple of buttons to learn before you can start playing. The tutorial explains the basic controls and lets you practice them after they show you although the tutorial was forced at the first opening of the game, which actually wasn’t that bad as it was only quite short. There is also a practice mode available where all the try hards can spend all day to practice more difficult moves and combos, don't be that person.My favourite part of Lethal League would have to be the game soundtrack and artwork. The music works well with the hit lag as well as the different stage artworks. This is one of the first things I look at when playing a game. Once it hit the starting screen when I first opened it and the music started with the announcer and his thundering voice saying “Lethal League!!” I knew this was going to be one of those games. Both the art style and the soundtrack to me give a 90’s american hip hop feel with some of the environments reflecting this. Yo! Like boom boxes and♥♥♥♥♥♥ The game gives that persistent feeling like all the individual components of the game gel together.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2014
												Lethal League is a fantastic fighting game that shines at its brightest with friends due to its accessibility, complexity, and consistency in providing incredible moments during matches. It plays like a fast-paced and dangerous game of ping pong and dodgeball where the ball will knock the stuffing out of you if you're hit.The accessibility comes from the simple concept of hitting the ball is good while being hit by the ball is bad. The tutorial  (located in EXTRAS) will take you through the basics and teach you enough to start smacking the ball around in different directions in different ways. You'll be exposed to the basic attack which adds only one speed to the ball, a charge up attack which can add up to x2 the current speed of the ball, and the down smash which always doubles the speed of the ball. You'll also be introduced to bunting which pops the ball up into the air no matter how fast it's going, your special which is usually the attack button during hit lag/pause (that freezing moment before you release the ball), and the jump button. You can also taunt or taunt + direction to emote. The complexity comes from all the subtleties found within the game. Each character has their own special moveset in regards to how they move, jump, and control their special. For example, Sonata has a double jump, Candyman have a floaty jump that reaches the top of the screen, while Latch can jump onto and then climb up and down walls. You can clash with other players resulting in one or both being stunned, bunt attacks, bunt bunts, control the direction of bunts, adjust your attacking angles, reduce the hitlag/pause by bunting before performing an air down smash or a charge attack so your opponent can't counter easily, and so on to the point that there are some helpful guides in the Community Hub that can improve your game once you're ready.As for moments, there are so many. One of my favorites happen to be this one match where I exchanged a ball going at 1,000,000 speed several times with a worthy opponent. Keep in mind the ball starts off at a default speed of 8 unless you change the settings. Here's a video showing some three player gameplay with different settings: 


YouTube™ Video: Lethal League Multiplayer 

			Views: 22		

			Just three matches.		

Finally, I'll mention the settings because you can drastically change the approach of how to play depending on what you choose. The game has two modes that I know of, stocks (think SSB) and points. Stocks rewards the player who's able to stay alive. Points rewards the player that can attain the most kills/knockouts. Ball tagging on means you don't have to fear the ball you just hit while turning it off means it's a danger to everyone at all times. You can also change the ball if you're at a high enough level. So far I've only played with the Big Ball which seems to have a bigger hitbox and a longer hit lag. You can also set the time limit or turn it off if in case you want to play for the most kills in five minutes or first to twelve kills.P.S. Play with friends or people. It's much, much less fun to play against the AI. You can use the in-game matchmaking or peeking in the Community Hub chat to find pick-up games if you don't have a group of friends for ball smashing.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												Fun and exciting to play, and to watch. While still being legitimately competetive. Lethal League is relatively bare, being a game about hitting a ball into dudes, with all the different buttons being different ways of hitting said ball, yet it is highly focused and concise.If you were one of those people who thought Divekick's bare-bones gameplay was quite a groundbreaking thing, but were bummed to discover the novelty wore off very quickly or otherwise never understood it in the first place, then maybe Lethal League will leave a better taste in your mouth. Even if you don't plan on playing it until you're one of the best ball-bunters online, you will be giddy with excitement everytime the ball accelerates to mach speeds and every strike is empowered with tense build-up. It is the most anime thing ever and it is great. (Disclaimer: This user does not personally invest in this application of the term "anime". Interpret loosely.)Here's to hoping Lethal League gets continued support, as well as sustained recognition.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												A great indie fighting game that combines the neutral game mechanics of 2d fighting games like street fighter and mortal combat, and the fun factor of the smash brothers series. Pros:A fun experience for people who enjoy fast paced, crazy fighting games.Relatively cheap, only $20 at the time of posting this.Great and helpful community.Cons:High skill ceiling, many people that are still playing have been for almost a year, and very good players with 400-500+ hours are usually going to be found in online matchmakingUnranked matchmaking, there's no ELO system of sorts, so you can play anyone from the range of a braindead squirrel, to a winner of 20 tournaments.Low player count in matchmaking, Lethal League usually does not have a high player count, and they're not always in online matchmaking, so you will sometimes keep matching up against someone you don't want to play against due to them being the only person online who you can play.Regardless, Lethal League is an incredibly fun and surprisingly complex fighting game, and if you're willing to put in the time and effort to get good, it can be a very self rewarding and fun experience.

I also love the way visual effects are tied in with the game's core mechanics, with distortion animations playing when the ball breaks certain speeds.The game's starting roster is small - just 5 characters - but they play quite differently. Some of the differences are obvious, like special attacks, jumps and special movement (like clinging to walls or skateboarding on the ceiling), while other differences are more subtle (like the angles of upwards and downwards strokes). There are rumours of more in the works, and it has been said that new characters will be added to the game in free updates.With all this in mind, Lethal League is a wonderful gem of a game, perfect for people who want something to play with friends, locally and online, and also great for competitive fighting game players looking for new ways to test their skills and reflexes without memorizing long combos.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												My favorite local multiplayer / casual fighter game on the market, as I write this.It's simple enough for new players to pick it up and actually have fun immediately, with enough depth and split-second timing to keep things fresh. The mechanics are elegant and well-considered (unlike Divekick), there's some thoughtfulness to the action (more than Samurai Gunn), it's easy to see what's going on, and fun for any level of play (the bad part of Towerfall), and doesn't lend itself to standoffs or ever get slow (Nidhogg). The music is great. It looks bad, but don't let that stop you. Netplay is fairly good (!). My favorite local multiplayer competitive game of 2014.

content:
Posted: April 22, 2016
Now this is a well-made party game.Sheet gets real man, this game is more fastpaced than trying to dodge the memes on 9gag when john cena came out. Trust me you do not want to be on a touhou in which John Cena participates. Not good for your mental health.Like, damn son, this is sick.Lethal League is an arena VS. in which you inflict damage only via ball. This just adds another layer of mindgames and cheeki breeki tactics.There are only 5 basic controls: move, jump, hit, "bunt" aka MINDGAMES (lob the ball for a very brief amount of time, goes back to whatever speed it was whenever it touches a surface else than ceiling), and of course, TAUNT.The ball gains speed by hitting it and it slows down by bunting it. But thing is, aerials *MULTIPLY* the ball's speed. Everything else just changes its speed by 1.When the ball's at high speeds it becomes a very intense dumbfest of epic.There are specials, by filling up a 4-stage gauge. Easy to do, and the specials are very dumb.Just with that, there's just a lot of tactics and tech shtuff you can come out with, characters have different perks, like double jump, faster weapon afterswing, more range, better lobs, more angle freedom on some moves...After all, it's addicting as all hell known and very fun to play. There's also a "challenge" mode (singleplayer arcade), which has a damn cool boss at the end.OST: Good, and very fitting.Character design: verry nice.Gameplay: Top Kek from Quebec.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Do you like fighting games? Do you like fighting games that have nothing to do with fighting?Lethal league is an amazing skill-based game. The idea is to take out your opponents by hitting them with a ball which speeds up to insane velocities. It gets to the point where you just can't see the ball and react with enough time, you must figure out where it's going and time your hit correctly. The game has multiple characters, each with their own abilities, movement characteristics and angles at which they respond the ball which keeps the matches varied. The music is good, but the art is amazing. The scenary and the colours change as a match gets more hectic. There are also a couple of play modes. Death mach, team death match and some goalkeeping game. The only problem is that sometimes finding a match takes a while.I fully recommend this game. I totally love it.

												TLDR: Great game. Not much when playing alone, but with friends it is TERRIFYING FUN!Lethal League is a game that sets the line between babies and men. A game of Russian Roulette where you and your competitor hit an antigravity ball back and forth at increasing speed until somebody gets wrecked and dies! I say this is the line of boys and men because I have had many a time where I've been cowering in fear, PRAYING that God will take the ball and protect his child from it. I then got to see God grab the ball and SLAM JAM it into my face screaming,"GET ♥♥♥♥ED BOY!"

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 29, 2015
												What can I say about Lethal League that hasn't already been said? It's a fantastic game, and one worth playing for quite a while! Team Reptile did an amazing job with this title, ranging from the excellent gameplay, to the beautiful soundtrack, even to the art the game displays so well. Let's have a jawbreaker and take a look, shall we? Intro: Lethal League is a game that will test you and make sure you make the right decisions, or you're going to strike out fast! The aim of the game is to smack a ball and try to hit your opponent with it to knock him out, which makes him lose a piece of health. Everytime you hit the ball it turns your color so you can't get hit until he hits it back! You play as one of six total characters: Raptor, Switch, Candyman, Sonata, Latch, and Dice. Each character hits the ball in different angles and has their own jump heights and abilities that make each of them stand out from one another. You've got your basic 15 year old baseball player, all the way down to a cyborg crocodile that uses his tail to hit the ball and a robot with a skateboard!Gameplay: The gameplay in Lethal League is absolutely amazing. It is so fun making the ball go thousands of miles per hour and always wondering if you'll hit the ball, or be hit yourself! You have some options of hitting the ball, such as doing a downward smash that doubles the ball speed, or just hitting it straight forward to try to trick your opponent into thinking it'll go somewhere else. Characters fill up a four bar meter everytime they hit the ball, and when full they can use their special attack which can do things like make the ball travel through walls or just eat it and spit it back out! The fun in Lethal League is the simplicity of it, and while simple, it is incredibly fun and satisfying.Music: Music in any game is usually why I keep playing. Lethal League's soundtrack is some of the greatest in indie game music that I've heard. Team Reptile really hit it out of the park with this one, and there was not one single song I disliked in this title. The menu music alone is just phenomenal, and tracks like Ordinary Days and Scream just add to the awesomeness of it. They all loop pretty nicely and sound very well done. The soundtrack in Lethal League will surely not disappoint you at all!Graphics: Lethal League overall looks pretty good for an indie game. The art of the characters is pretty sweet, and so are the backgrounds of each stage. It's also amazing to look at the stages changes the faster you hit the ball, and I feel just makes it way more satisfying to reach insane speeds! The animations feel a bit clunky and weird though, but not something that I really payed much attention to. I will say though, if you want a headache then go ahead and play this game for hours, as it will probably hurt your eyes! Conclusion: I most likely missed some elements and whatnot but I really only wanted to touch on those three topics. That being said, this is a game you MUST play. I recommend it for everyone who loves fighting games and playing with friends. To have the best experience, please do grab some friends and enjoy the hell out of this game! You might not like the 14 dollar price on this game, and that is reasonable due to how simple the game is, but it is worth the money. If you can get some friends, then no doubt you'll be hitting homeruns in no time! Rating: 9/10

												10/10If you like fighting games, pong, DBZ, or any variation on those themes. You are in the right place. It incorporates simple, easy to understand concepts with intensely reactive meta game in order to accomplish a speedy-twitch strike style of gameplay you'll find nowhere else. Lacking slightly in content, the developers plan to make at least one more stage and character for the game with the hope that more will follow! Pick it up and I'll see you in game. ;)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 14, 2015
												Most fun I've ever had in any local multiplayer game, even if I keep losing TT_TT---ReviewAs I have said, Lethal League is a very fun multiplayer game. It is easy to learn but hard to master, and has a pretty high skill cap.Pros: Memorable catchy house music. A unique concept of pong/baseball/fighting all combined into one game that is really blood-pumping and may cause some screaming if you're playing a LAN. Solid mechanics The controls are tight 6 different characters you can choose from with different abilities (and hit angles). You can play in quick short bursts, maybe when you're queuing for a Dota 2 game, CSGO, anything really. The art is unique. The animations are very smooth. The voice acting isn't cringe-worthy and is very well done. Playing with lag is somewhat manageable, unlike in some FPS and other games where lag is very important to not have. Hardly any bugs.Cons: Current playerbase isn't too big so actually finding a game is sometimes impossible. You can check on SteamDB[steamdb.info] to see how many players are playing at the moment so you can actually find an opponent. Price is a bit too expensive for some people. Rare crashes.That's all I could think of for cons, really.WishlistThe things I wish was in the game More characters A cheaper price to increase the playerbaseFINAL VERDICT:85/100This game is really different to most other fighting games, if you can afford it, buy it when it is on sale, usually it's around $5, so get it!

content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												Great game, deserves a reward.The game is a strange competitive game, you try to hit the enemy with the ball you hit, each hit increases the speed making it somewhat challenging to hit the ball and satisfying when you hit it.The music is great for each map, the art style is awesome, brings me back to the good old Jet Set Radio art vibe and all around beautiful.The characters are not serious, making the competitive aspect of the game less fustrating as you feel like you're having fun. When you die you know what happened to you and you just want to improve from it, it's one of the main things what I love about lethal league.7/10Reason why I give it a 7/10 is because it lacks communication to the community, yeah, there's almost like an update almost every month or two, but, I mean, with the newer games these days, developers normally make blogs about what's going on. Fan art and things like that, I'd really love to see some from Lethal League.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												"Lethal League is a competitive projectile fighting game where you have to hit an anti-gravity ball into the face of your opponent to win." That description is spot. Lethal League is a ton of fun though. Once you got used to how the game works the ridiculous amount of things that can happen are endless. The game offers three different game modes; free for all, team, and strikers. Free for all is exactually what you would expect up to for people all trying to knock eachother out by hitting the ball. Team is the same way other than being able to work with your teammate to control the pace of the game. Stirikers is basically soccer where each team is trying to hit the ball into the other teams goal while also trying to protect your own. For free for all I would reccomend three people because with four people the game gets to hectic for me personally. Also the soundtrack in this game is sweet! Overall though I would highly recommend this game to anyone as long as you have friends to play with. I would give this game a solid 8/10 with the only thing holding it back being the replay value since it relies so much on one type of gameplay some people may get bored fairly quickly.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 25, 2015
												It's hard to find games that are playable in local multiplayer, are really easy to pick up, and ALSO have a lot of depth and challenge. Lethal League is pretty simple overall, but is just perfect. Its controls involve just three buttons; not "Divekick" excessive simplicity, but enough that people won't shy away from picking up the third or fourth controller. Even so, there's definitely enough variety of play at work. There's also a great tactile feel to mashing a ball around at each other,I've been bringing a laptop loaded with this game to a local bar, and people were very quick to pick up on it; several people there are probably better than I'll ever be already. (I still don't know how to do poses as each character!)(fyi: little playtime on my account because I've hooked it up at a bar, on a laptop that's always offline)

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2015
												Lethal League is one of the most original fighters I've played in a while to the point where I'm not even sure if it could be called a fighter. But, its lack of content (especially in the singleplayer front) makes this game only worth it for a few laughs with friends.The story is non-existent in this game, but the characters you get to play as and the stages you play in are really interesting and have a very unique style reminiscent of something like Jet Set Radio. The world presented in the stages looks very interesting but you never get to explore it or get to know more about it. Nevertheless, they make for a good visualizer inbetween rounds for this game's excellent soundtrack.The gameplay revolves around a ball which you hit to make it turn your color which means that any players hit who aren't the same color (assuming you're in a team battle) die instantly. They can hit it again though and make it go faster and faster and faster until someone is hit. This game is so simple yet so mind numbingly complex in its mechanics that it welcomes players from any skill level. Casually, this is a fun game to play with up to 3 friends. Competitively, this is a game riddled with mechanics to be discovered and tactics to be used. This is the perfect balance for any fighter.But then there's that. This isn't quite a fighter... This is more like "Super Pong Bros." in a way. But unlike the Nintendo money machine, this game isn't riddled with content, unlockables or anything really to make for a solid singleplayer experience. This game's only content as far as I'm concerned is playing with friends and to some extent online play. It's unusual mechanics don't really make it pro tournament and competitive play material, although I could see it entirely.In the end, Lethal League's mechanics more than make up for the lack of content, and while its visual aesthetic can be called archaic for some, it can be seen as artistic. The diversity in the very small roster of characters is there, albeit not too game changing since the only change is usually only the special attack that can be used after 4 successful hits on the ball. Skins and trophies are there for a singleplayer experience, but... I wouldn't advise you playing this game unless at least one friend would play with you as well.Worth checking out.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												What can I say about this gem?Well I can say this; this game is the most fun I've had with a multiplayer game. Playing this game with friends is an awesome and frantic experience. Equally I just enjoyed batting it about with the CPUs when I bought the game the day after I played it at a friends. My one suggestion to the developer is to add some custom features (like changing the default ball speed or the gravity) and some other modes would be cool (tag team matches or something)Probably one of the best examples of a good indie game. The soundtrack is mind meltingly good, the thick electro and trance providing the perfect backdrop for a flawless game. The controls feel good. The sound design has that great new retro feel - evoking sweet sweet tones of Jet Set Radio. Rarely has the word eargasm been so applicable. The voice acting has that cool 90s feel - "WIIIIIIIIPEEEE OUUUUT"If you want to buy any party game, or a game for just chilling with or a game that is just plain amazing. Then buy this. A nice change from boring bland  brown survival games that seem to be churning out from some early access hell hole. This game deserves your money and it deserves to be on every platform available - probably even the NeoGeo

content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
												Lethal League is one of the most fun games I've ever played.First, It's got one of the best GGPO connections out there. I can play with my friends even when the family is destroying my internet connection with streams and netflix.It's Pong, but you control a character and smash the ball against your opponent, until the ball goes so fast it breaks the universe and one of you takes it to the face. Not only that, but Lethal League has a 4 player feature, making it even more chaotic. Packed with a Artstyle that will probably remind you of Jet Set Radio, it also has one of the best soundtracks out there. It's 10/10 on anyone's list, I'm sure.What are you waiting for? go buy it and play with your friends! You'll have a lot of fun.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 3, 2016
												This game clearly draws a lot from 2-D fighters, and games like Super Smash Bros. While it is somewhat lacking in depth of mechanics and focuses more on memorization of trajectories, this game is certainly enjoyable to pick up with some friends. The art in the game is nice, albeit unpolished, but if you are going to play the game for longer than a few hours I would recommend muting it, as the sounds made by the characters are infuriatingly awful. I would recommend this game if you are looking for something inspired by Super Smash Bros but don't want an actual fighting platformer like Rivals of Aether.

												Simple to learn, difficult to master, but every bit of fun. The deadliest game of Pong is the must-own game of 2014, in my book. If you like fighting games at all, and remember the hype of the UFGT 9 Finals match, then you really should try Lethal League in its Steam form. The music is extremely bangin', and you can easily find the tracks in the music folder, to rock out to whenever. No weak ****. No complex move lists. No johns. Just insane, adrenaline-pumping, lethal and unadulterated madness.Just play it. The price is well worth it.

content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												Lethal League knocks it out of the park, without even trying. The mechanics to this fighter are straightforward and very easy to understand. Two to four characters hit a baseball around an arena, trying to hit the other players with it. If a player hits the ball back, the speed of the ball increases. You can “bunt” the ball, temporarily knocking it straight up, but once it’s hit again or touches the ground it will resume its previous velocity. If a player manages to hit the ball four times, they can do a special move that varies by character.It sounds simplistic on paper, but the ball velocity gets so high that your only view of it is as a straight line bisection the arena. Timing is critical, strategy vital, and seat-of-your-pants tactics (wild panic works too) all combine into a high-octane fight unlike anything I’ve seen before. In a very strange, oblique way, it reminds me of high-level play in Rockstar’s Table Tennis. Lethal League has even replaced Soul Calibur as my favorite fighting game.If you’re curious about the game, you can play the original prototype of Lethal League here: http://lethalleague.reptile-games.com/prototype/ - it’s not quite the same as the full game, but it’s enough to give you a good impression.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												Jet Set Pong Smash Bros.This game is great fun.  Controls are snappy and the music is awesome.  My only gripe is one of the characters "death" soundfile is "<grunt>, D--nit, D--nit, D--nit!"  Not too bad unless two people choose Candyman and you are listening to it 5 times a minute.  And it seems louder than the other voices.  Really a problem since my kids enjoy playing this game, and its difficult to explain to their parents in a party setting.  --PCMasterRace Solution--------------The offending file is "candy_gethit_b.wav"It's located at ...\lethalleague\resources\audio\voiceover\candy\Open with Audacity (free software, and awesome), delete the swearing, and export/overwrite back to .wavNow it's just a grunt.  -----------------------------------------My kids' favorite party game on PC.Paid full price. No regrets.

content:
Posted: January 16
												You hit a ball, change its colour and this way the ball can KO your opponent. When he gets hit a number of times, you win.The premise is interesting but gets old quickly. Changing the direction of the ball when hitting it is difficult because of the controls (you can direct the ball with up and down keys and you jump with another key). This game would be easier to play with keyboard plus mouse, using the mouse to direct the ball. It would also be easier to jump using the up key instead of a separate jump bind.Music is decent. Graphics are so so. Characters don't seem to have any story about them and instead of a Story Mode you have a Challenge Mode which for some reason is in a secondary menu. I think that, given the simple gameplay, there should be some other play modes to keep up your interest. Specially for single player.It can be fun to play with other people on same screen. It seems there are not many players left for online multiplayer games.

content:
Posted: January 13
												Now before I start, this is not a bad game. But even though it's playable alone, multiplayer is practically a requirement for this game to be worth it. The Challenge mode ranges from unduly hard to boringly easy. Sometimes, you'll never get the ball speed over 50MPH, other times, the CPU you took out with a lame 40MPH ball will deflect your 250MPH shot with a single frame of notice. The AI is inconsistent and doesn't prepare you for multiplayer play at all, because they do not behave like normal humans. Some will charge you and stay on top of you when it's the least safe situation to do so, just so they can hit the ball where you have a single frame to react. Others will bunt the ball repeatedly on one side of the arena for no discernible reason. You would think there would be enough people around to pick and play random people online, but no amount of waiting eve seems to get me to find another person. So what does that mean? It means you're only going to be able to play this game with people you expressly invite to play with you. And at a $14-$40 price tag to get everyone equipped with their own copy of the game, it's not worth what will probably be a half hour session. Or less. With only six characters to choose from, there's very little replay value in the same session, let alone over multiple ones, so like many other Steam games that fill a super specific niche, get this one on sale. And get some for your friends too, because you're going to need them if you plan to have any fun with this game.

Posted: November 9, 2014
												Amazing mechanic, original idea, excellent execution. Basically, there is a ball that spawns in the middle at the start of the game. Players then must try to hit the ball into eachother's face. Except, everytime the ball is hit, it speeds up until eventually the screen changes color at like 100 mph.  There is also different characters each with their own abilities. Candyman's is when you hit the ball it goes all pacman and goes into the wall on one side and comes to the other. I give this a 7.5/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												This is one of the best games I have played in a long while.  This game is extremely fast paced as you smack a ball around a single room and hit other players with it, while avoiding the ball when someone else hits it.  This game has many zany characters that have different special abilities which make the game even crazier!This is one of the few games that I STRONGLY reccommend to anyone who loves certain Super Popular, Super Smashing games *cough* Super Smash Bros *cough*, because it plays like Super Smash bros but in a Pong-like fashion.  I give this game a 5/5 in my books!If you have the spare money, again, I STRONGLY recommend getting this game.

Posted: September 6, 2014
												Although the game has simple mechanics, it's a very intense and challenging game that does one thing very well; provide insanely fun gameplay. The soundtrack is also fantastic. The character design is a bit uninspired, and the animation at points is a bit less than what you would expect, but all that doesn't really matter when you're having such a brilliant time.There's future content on the way as well, so I would definitely recommend picking this up, especially during a sale. Absolutely thrilling experience if you've got a group of friends to duke it out with.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
												Initial impressions. Very addictive! I regretted buying it at first, no idea why. Totally fun. I'd have to say it's 1 part luck, 9 parts skill. For how simple the controls are, there's a surprising amount of strategy that factors in. Timing is huge as well. Worth a buy for sure. Online matches are fun as hell, and every character handles differently, in major and subtle ways.If you like fighters, but want a simpler alternative to all the combos, this is fun to pick up and play.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2014
												Let me start out by saying I really dont like arcade style fighter games. This is the first exception I have found.Lethal league involves hitting a ball into other players. The ball gradually speeds up until it gets to insane high speeds. Unlike most arcade fighter games movement in incredibly important and memorising combos is unnecessary.You have three skills, hitting the ball, bunting the ball (which stops the balls movement, and a special attack cast by double hitting the hit button after scoring four previous hits on the ball. Each character has a different special attack.Lethal league is graphically and musically stylish and appealing as well as insanely fun.Subscribe to my curator page for more local multiplayer recommendations: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/7189360/Check out my Couch Gaming group for specials, bundles, etc: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CGLM

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												In a dystopian future where baseball is actually entertaining, a skateboarding robot, a deranged candy salesman, and a hipster crocodile battle it out for supremacy.Lethal league is a fighting game based around the premise of pong. While each character has a special move and the ability to attack one another, the only way to knock out your opponent is by smashing an oversized baseball into them. A deceptively simple premise that turns out to be a lot harder than it sounds, the ball will continue to move faster with each hit making it harder to predict and counter.Pros-Shockingly addicting-Great Sound track-Decent number of game mods with up to four players (1v1, team battle, ffa, stock/point etc)-ggpo netcodeCons-Not much of a single player (granted it is a fighter)Definitely worth a buy if you're looking for a quirky fighter to play online or with friends.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												So this game is only just released today, and you might think, "How can he write a review so early after release?"Valid arguement, but counterable with: the game is super short and super simple. I am not an expert at this game, far from it. But the games' mechanics are very easy to learn, infact the tutorial is ~2 minutes long. That being said, I am going to continue playing this game for quite a while, it feels absolutely WONDERFUL to smack the ball around, especially the faster it gets, and you start shouting at the screen to get it.The price point is imo too high, 14 isn't pocket change, considering how much the game actually has inside. I got super hyped and bought it anyway, but that decision is up to you.The online connection is phenomenal, very very few cases when it felt off or jumpy. If I didn't know I was alone, I couldn't tell that the players weren't right next to me. One big probelem though is that if it desyncs, then it's just about over for that room. But i've only had that happen once in the ~16 games I've played as of writing this.Now, if they added Local Play, this game would be completely worth the price, hopefully they add that feature. If you're worried about dumping the cash to pick this up, wait till it goes on sale. Even 10 would be good imo, but I also thought 14 was an acceptable loss

content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												I got this game on sale quite a while ago - and at that point my only experience was with single-player. I held off on a review, because I would have thumbs-downed it. Why does this title have overwhelmingly positive reviews on Steam?!It must be played with controllers on a couch with local multiplayer. This is where this game shines. There is alot of screaming and shouting and laughing. Lots of twitching. Great fun. Pros:+Excellent concept - bringing such a fresh breath of life to stale fighting games+Brilliantly simple controls - no tedious combos to memorize+Characters each have their own specialties - it seems subtle, though+Music is pretty goodCons:-While this game is crazy fun, there is wasted potential at this point IMO, I really think there is TONS of room for expansion, such as:-Needs more playable characters-Needs better artwork, IMO-Needs more playable levels-Needs more gameplay modes (only 3 right now)Overall, the fun factor is pretty much through the roof with this title. If you have couch coop opportunities, this is a no brainer.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												I don't remember how I was introduced to the prototype, but I shared it with my housemates and we've played hours worth of games over the course of the last six months. The simplicity, the visceral feedback, and the mindgames are what really make this game special. You can learn all the mechanics there is to learn in about 2 minutes, but what really takes a long time is learning how to read your opponent, what they're going to do and how to prepare for you. TotalBiscuit criticised the art style, but I have to disagree with him - The Boombox culture of south central los Angeles personified in cartoon form is a really fresh direction for a game to take. Maybe the palette has been exaggerated and might be a bit noisy, but I'll be damned if every single hit, every single return of the ball with the little flash particle animations isn't an instant dopamine hit.TL;Dr - simple game with a lot of strategic depth, great music, fresh art, solid mechanics. Recommend to everybody, I hope the guys at Reptile make millions of dollars.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 8, 2016
												I can finally tell my friends I play League.... Oh, right. I'm writing a review. Here's my pros and cons list if you don't want to read the rest of my review.Pros: Fast-paced high-intensity gameplay that only increases in speed and intensity as the match goes on Beginner-friendly with an optional tutorial that can be replayed as many times as needed, as well as a practice mode 6 characters to choose from with unlockable character colors the more you play Online and local multiplayer supports up to 4 players Free-for-all and Team Battle game modes Single player campaign mode available (and achievements for beating it with each character) Gameplay is fluent and customizable with either keyboard or controller, controlled with 3 buttons outside the four directional movement buttons Amazing Soundtrack (at least, I think so)Cons: Lethal League online translates to Lethal Lag; I'd recommend not playing online if you and your friends do not have a fast and reliable internet connection Not much variety in terms of content; the single player campaign is just a series of battles against CPU opponents. Depending on your musical tastes, you might not like the soundtrack. This can always be remedied by adjusting the in-game volume settings and playing your own music over the game. The long version of the review If I was to describe Lethal League in one sentence, it would be Baseball Combat. You play as one of 6 characters, each with a different ability, and you hit the ball back and forth until it hits someone. When you get hit by the ball, you lose a life; when you lose all your lives, you've lost the match. I should note that hitting other characters directly does absolutely nothing, so you have to focus on hitting the ball such that it collides with your opponent. Up to 4 players can play at once, and the game modes include a free-for-all deathmatch as well as a team battle mode which supports both 2vs2, 1vs2 and 1vs3 modes. Friendly fire is optional (referred in-game as ball tagging) to allow a more intense experience should you choose to play with it. This game is very keyboard friendly if you don't have a controller (as I don't have a very good controller); controlled with the directional arrow keys for movement and the Z, X and Spacebar for other movements, you can re-map all the controls as you see fit in the options menu. My friend can confirm that this game plays great with a controller as well.Where I think this game shines brightest is its multiplayer, especially when playing with friends. With friends, regardless of how much I was winning or losing, not a moment went by where we weren't having the time of our lives. This game is very easy to learn as the controls are limited to movement, jumping, hitting the ball and bunting the ball (hitting it lightly), and the optional replayable in-game tutorial explains things sufficiently. Overall, this game is best played with friends, but can be played just as well solo. Definitely recommended, especially if it's on sale.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												Like a good sequel should,  Call of Duty: Ghosts  Lethal League doesn’t ignore the formula of fast, fluid gameplay that has made the series famous, but introduces a unique new premise, unprecedented player personalization, and sweeping changes that breathe new life into the multiplayer experience. It’s over-the-top and at times unnecessarily complex, but serves both current and next-generation consoles with ambitious new ideas and tremendous replay value.Despite sharing a name with one of  Modern Warfare’s  Lethal League best-known characters, Ghosts takes place in an entirely new Call of Duty universe set in the not-too-distant future. In a genre overwrought with antiquated Russian conflicts and ambiguous Middle Eastern terrorist threats, Ghosts takes on a refreshingly unique premise in which the threat comes not from the east, but the south: a federation of oil-rich South American nations rises to take over the hemisphere, pushing north and coming to blows with the U.S.The prelude establishes a harrowing vision of a United States homeland that's broken but not beaten – not quite Red Dawn, but not Fallout 3, either. It’s a space not often explored by modern shooters, and its mood is heightened by missions set in a besieged Santa Monica and the wasted remains of San Diego, to the tune of an excellent, somber score from David Buckley (The Town, Metal Gear Solid 4). But ultimately, time on the poignant homefront is short lived as the story goes behind enemy lines in Caracas, the Andes mountains, and other exotic locales.Those might lack to familiarity, but the variety of environments keeps the campaign fresh, not only in terms of visuals, but in gameplay as well. Instead of just fighting waves of enemies through a linear stage at ground level, you’ll find yourself rappelling down skyscrapers, flying helicopters, having firefights in space, commanding tanks, scuba diving through shipwrecks, playing as a dog, and evading shark attacks. Each requires new strategy, acute situational awareness, and – in the case of the space and water missions – special consideration for verticality and physics.Of course, it wouldn’t be a Call of Duty game without elaborate setpieces, fierce shootouts, and tense stealth missions, and Ghosts delivers some of the most memorable experiences in the series. I felt genuine dread as the ground and buildings collapsed around me during orbital weapons strikes, the zero-gravity spectacle of the Federation’s space station ambush is awe-inspiring, and bursting through a highrise window as the entire building crumbles during the Federation Day mission is exhilarating.But like previous CoDs, the story of Ghosts struggles to remain in focus amidst the fray of explosive cinematic moments and relentless firefights. Narrated loading sequences with stylized story animations push the campaign forward, but only last for one or two minutes before launching back into the action. It’s there, on the front lines, that much of the plot progression is presented and oftentimes lost.It's by no means an achievement in dramatic storytelling — it's more about dumb fun — and it lacks the player-choice element introduced with Call of Duty: Black Ops II, but when given time to breathe Ghosts actually offers some interesting human drama. The story centers around two brothers, Logan and Hesh, their father Elias, and yes, their dog Reilly as they fight the Federation as part of the battered remnants of the U.S. military, and later as the elite Ghosts squad. The family ties, specifically the relationship between Logan and Hesh, made me care about the protagonists in a series that's habitually made its characters a dispensable commodity. The voice acting is decent overall, though there are periodic moments of cringe-worthy dialog, like one superfluous moment when Elias reveals he’s a member of the Ghosts. And then there’s Riley. Though the subject of many a meme at this point, Riley not only acts as a useful tool for recon and silently dispatching enemies, but is integral to several dramatic sequences, saving your character on more than one occasion.The story stumbles in the second act when it strays away from the more evocative character focus in favor of a long stretch of back-to-back missions driven almost exclusively by guns-blazing combat. While not poorly done, this visually arresting, action-packed, but ultimately hollow middle stands in stark contrast to the effective first and final acts. On the bright side, that padded out my play time to roughly 10 hours, making this campaign one of the longest CoD single-player experiences.The Verdict Call of Duty: Ghosts  Lethal League isn't a reinvention of the franchise, but proves there's still room for innovation within its existing formula. Though at the risk of overcomplicating things at times, its robust multiplayer gameplay, surprisingly fun co-op modes, and lengthy, challenging, and varied campaign makes  Ghosts  Lethal League one of the best Call of Duty games to date.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2016
												I gave this game many chances to improve me because of the overwhelmingly positive reviews, but I've come to the conclusion this game does not work well with the controller.  I've tried using both a steam controller and x360 controller and this game has the weirdest problems with my controllers.  Whenever I press left on the analog controller, it would pause the game.  Also, the game was clearly designed for keyboad and mouse because when you use the controller the analog stick becomes a pointer and in order to select your opponent in a CPU game you have to click this little narrow box.  It's very unintuitive.  If this dev really wants this game to take off like Rocket League or some such (this game was recommended to my because of my love for RL), they need to make the interface with the controller more intuitive and iron out many bugs.  At it's current form, I can't recommend this game for people with controllers.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2014
												Love fighting games? Have a thing for geometry based action?Dig Baseball? Enjoy warping space and time with super sonic boombox hammers?If so this game is the cure for your terminally dull gaming career!Harness the power of the speed force and go Wally West on folks!Get now if you got the balls!...you see what I did there...sigh... of corse you did. Was a terrible joke. But really the game is worth picking up. Havent had this much fun playing a game in a while. Screaming at my screen at times getting so hype, amazed at the returns back and forth.  Easy to learn hard to master mechanics with complex tricks and traps to practice. As far as I've seen online is clean as hell with only the rare DC here and there. It would have to be to support the insane speeds the game can reach matched with the reaction times it takes to return the ball. The price is a little high but well worth for the pure fun of the game. Pick it up take a swing at it...sorry ill stop.

content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
												This game is a nice twist of fighting and dodgeball. The gameplay is simple, you hit the ball it goes faster, if you hit your opponent, they lose a life. And even though the controls may be minimal, there are a lot of complex combos you can pull off with the ball.If you have no friends to play with, no worries! There are 2 (3 if you count training) SinglePlayer gamemodes to try out by yourself.This game is fun to play with your friends, or a fun way to chillax on your own.Cons:-Buggy-Online is Laggy-Menus do not have the "life" they deserve-Minimal character choice-Random seems rigged, if two or more people choose random, they will usually always be the same character (not 100% proven)- Final Rating: 88/100 -

number of helpful: 21 of 45 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												Pong Fighter is the simple description of lethal league, a cool new games from Team Reptile makers of megabyte punch another suto fighting game. lethal league is simple to learn  but at its core it has a very high skill level. Only 3 buttons jump, strike, and punt but using good timing and learning angels with these tools you will be striking your opponent out while you're running home on a Grand Slam R.B.I.heres my full written review Lethal league is a game where the hype never stops  and neither does the ball. the core game is like combat pong  or dodge ball but there is a lot of nuance moves and tricks the make this game competitive and really fun.play with your friends. even if you don't have any, GO ONLINE and play against some other online warriors, don't want to get rekt. the challenge mode will keep you busy the fun never stops with a myriad of different stages and retro music that will remind you of jet set radio- always a good thing. the game is by team reptile the same people behind megabyte punch which came out august of 2013.after making megabyte punch the games developers were showing off a new kind of fighting game at major competitions the game was praised and so lethal league was born.the gameplay of lethal league is simple you can't really do much you can jump strike and punt. only 3 buttons but the maneuvers you can string together using these 3 buttons are essential to mastering the game. each one of your moves jump, strike, and  punt all have a different functionality depending on the situation and character.each character has a unique jump mechanic such as wall jump double jump ect. all characters have a downward strike will jumping. and all characters have a special move after hitting something 4 times.there are 5 characters so far. switch,raptor,sonata,candyman and latch. learning your characters move set, mobility, and strengths is key to knowing what to do in each situation and really adds depth to the game. my 2 favorite character so far are switch and sonta, switch  can ride on the walls and has a pretty horizontal swing. on the other hand sonata has a double jump and had a pretty vertical swing . each character differences do add some subtly to the game and doesn't change the core gameplay. unlike other fighting game where u have to know each character's inputs and timing this game is all about timing so u can hope on any character pretty much and still be competent. the moment to moment gameplay can look a little daunting to new players but the simple mechanics make it easy to hop in the game and just play and once you start to learn how to predict the ball then thats when you'll really get into the deep nuance  of this game. the developers did a good job of showing you the basic of the gameplay in their tutorial while still giving you the opportunity to discover new game mechanics on your own. overall the gameplay is simple yet hard to master and thats what u want ina competitive game getting into a game online is really easy its been a good number of people playing everytime i how on must i had to wait for a game was 1-2 minutes but most happen withen 30 secs. im on the west coast so your milage may vary the gameplay is great and all but what i think really deserves praise is the music and art tim and dion did a great job with a game art the style of the art really fits the game a sorta pixel art of future streetscapes and urban environments really adds to the feel of the games atmosphere the music gets me pumped to play so lethal league. i can listen to the music without the game. thats the sign of good music. a sorta mix sounds like the music for the jet set series with a modern twist  im having fun with lethal league and even though it won't be my go to competitive game i'm glad i have it in my library and i can hop in anytime and play the best version of pong there is :D7/10slightly abouve wolfstien the new oder Video Impressions

content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
												Hitting the ball back and forth has never been so much fun! It sounds simple enough, but you have to time your hits.. just right, and online play can be a bit rough. It does seem to be pretty active, even late at night with online play. Log on at 1AM find a match, during the day, find a match, so on and so forth. Downside to this game is it allows people that can be way outside of your region to join which can make the games sometimes laggy. Online play, Offline Multiplayer, andd. Challenge mode! Got it all for $5, and although there is better games out there.. this is the only one that I am aware of that plays the way it does. It's unique, and definitely worth it to get it during a sale price.Goodluck and have fun if you decide to get it :)Update: Game is fun yes, but after playing more there is way too many laggers, too much game crashing, and the people on the forums are rather condescending to those stating facts. Heck. Even some long-time players agree that hte game crashes way too much. Not exactly promising it would get fixed. Also, gets a bit repetitive. It's fun.. but not fun enough for a thumbs up anymore. I'll still play it on occasion, but meh.Side note: Being taunted by laggers in games is kind of annoying too. It's like. "Hey, you're bad but in reality i'm the lagger that can't get a good connection." and no, i'm not referring to those that are not even close to your region, i'm talking those in the same area as you that somehow have a ridic ping.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												♥♥♥♥ing YES!The idea of a competetive sports game isn't that uncommon. In the early days there was Windjammers. A discthrowing 1v1 pong-like game in a form of a fightinggame with different specialmoves and characters.This game on the other hand takes those Ideas and give them a new look and feel and resembles one of the most unique games of this decade.#### What are we doing exactly? #####The goal of the game is getting a ball to hit your opponents. You can hit the ball in many directions and the ball is bouncing of the walls. There are different attacks and specials you can do to speed up the ball or causing it to change directions.####### Gameplay ######Smooth as butter. Easy to learn, hard to master. You can get relatively far with just playing with feel and a little bit random button presses. But if you learn how to combo, parry and reducing your hitlag, you can get constant wins.####### Graphics #######The graphics are completely 2D. It looks like it was done by MS Paint, but it has its own funky style. The graphics are snappy and look good. Especially the effects when you hit the ball as it reaches the speeds of  max 1000000pixel/s (I think thats the speedindex)####### Balance ########The game seems to be well balanced. Every character is different and has a specialattack and peculiarities like walljump, doublejump, wallclinging and driving across the ceiling with a skateboard. Also the angles, in which the ball flies after a hit, are different aswell. Because it is more about how you handle the ball, i don't think there will be overpowered characters.####### Network ########The netcode is powered by ggpo. You can feel how good the netcode is.. even with 4 players it's smooth as hell. There are some hickups, witch result in disconnects, but considering the age of the game, I wouldn't be surprised if the game got some updates to fix this. After all it's just a little annoyance, which is forgotten after you desperately try to reconnect to the massive fun. (which is fast anyway)###### Conclusion ######The game is a must-have. The fun we had in just 6 hours was tremendous. The game is best played with 4 players, in a 2v2 teammatch.
