content:
Posted: November 29, 2015
												I like this game, I just don't know if I can recommend it. Pros:- I love the art style, it's awesome and the art is awesome, from the characters to the stages.- The music is also really great.- Gameplay is interesting and a different take on traditional fighting games.Cons:- Finding lobbies is difficult- The mechanics don't have a ton of depthAt the end of the day, I was already bored of it after a few hours. Trying to find lobbies just to play a fighting game with not much depth to the mechanics wasn't worth it to me. I'm not sure if the concept of a 2 button fighting game is supposed to be a selling point, but to me it wasn't. There's no combos, no blocks, no grabs, and nothing that really gives you  the rock-paper-scissors aspect of fighting games you expect in the genre. If you're new to fighting games and don't expect much in the way of depth of mechanics, this would be fine. For me, it's not enough. I wish I enjoyed it more though, because the art and the soundtrack are all amazing.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												First Try on Lethal League!The video can be found here: 


YouTube™ Video: First Try: Lethal League 

			Views: 94		

			Disclaimer: I was provided with a reviewcopy of the game. Get it on steam: http://store.steampowered.com/app/261180/		

Lethal League is an interesting take on a projectile based fighting game.The controls are reduced to their bare minimum, giving you the option to jump, hit and punt, but the timing of these commands is what divides the good from the best. Since the ball can be hit in any angle you want there are a lot of factors to consider on how and when to hit it or if you want to slow the ball down with a punt to smash it more acurrately. Currently there are 5 playable characters available, which for a launch line-up is okay, but I hope that more characters will be added soon. Each character has its own special ability which you can use when your power meter(I haven't heard an official name for that yet) is full. You can fill your power meter by hitting the ball and when it's full you can release your special ability by pressing the hit button again while you are hitting the ball. What is quite notable as well is that each character has special movment and jumping capabilities. For example, Candyman cannot walljump, therefore he is able to jump higher.There are also 6 levels, but here are some weakpoints the game has in my opinion. The levels are just backgrounds, there is no real interaction with what is going on in the front. For example there is a level where you are on a street. In the background you see a tank(at least it looks like one to me) and buildings. Wouldn't it be awesome, if these elements would come into play, for example the tank shoots one of the buildings and rubble is coming down and affects the ball or makes you go away from certain areas? At least I would like that.Another thing is that the graphical fidelity leaves a lot to be desired. While I dig the artstyle that looks like jet-set radio in 2D, the backgrounds just don't really look that good. What is great though is the animations quality which give you a nice feel of the velocity of the ball and let the controlls feel really good. It also has to be noted that the stop motion moments when hitting a very fast ball are extremely funny and change depending on what level you are currently at.The game also features a progression system which lets you unlock new colouring for the playable characters. Last, but not least, let's talk about the soundeffects and the soundtrack. The soundeffects are quite nice and there is a nice variety on sound cues available. The soundtrack itself features different artists. To be honest, it is not my style of music, but I found it really fitting and enjoyable at times. Having not tried the multiplayer yet, there is one big component missing, but from what I've heard, the netcode is working fine, only disconnects seem to make big trouble. Now to the conclusion: Is the game worth it? In my opinion there is a lot of fun and enjoyment to be had in this game, especially when you have 3 other to people to play and talk with in Skype or Teamspeak. It is easy to learn, but hard to master(I normally hate these sayings, but when it's true I can't help it). So even if you are not that good at the game, you might be able to get your enjoyment out of it.The only thing, people might be turned off by is the graphics, but in my opinion this game is a case of gameplay beating graphics in terms of making a joyful experience. The price is 12€ or your regional equivalent. Buying a 4 or a 2 pack is even more recommended, because of the reasons that are stated above.

content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
												 World of Tanks is the first and only team-based massively multiplayer online action game dedicated to armored warfare. Throw yourself into the epic tank battles of World War II with other steel cowboys all over the world. Your arsenal includes more than 150 armored vehicles from America, Germany, and the Soviet Union, carefully detailed with historical accuracy. A flexible system of authentic vehicle upgrade and development allows you to try any of the vehicles and weapons in the game. Whether you prefer to exhaust your foes with fast and maneuverable light tanks, make deep breaches in enemy lines with all-purpose medium tanks, use the force of giant tanks to eliminate opposing armored forces, or become a heavy sniper with long-range howitzers, each unit type has its own advantages and can be extremely effective when operated by a true tank ace. But being a great tank commander alone isn't enough to win! In World of Tanks, it's all about teamwork. Victory is achieved by combining your combat skills with those of the other members of your team, each playing their own role on the battlefield. Just add your favorite strategy to build your own iron empire and manifest the indisputable authority of the tank! Feel the tank power!(Mei is thicc af)

content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
Must buy at any price [x]Worth the money but wait for a small sale [x]Wait for a huge discount [x]Avoid at all costs [✓]Yes, I've only got 0.2 hours on this game but it was enough to tell me the summary of this game.First of all, I've got this off of Humble Bundle so I didn't think much of it, then I remembered what this game was and couldn't wait for the "amazing" experience.The game is indie so you won't expect much, but wait, the game is 12Euro (£10 , $13). That's alot for an indie game, especially for such a simple one.I'm pretty sure when this game was new the devs basically payed youtubers for good advertisment, from videos this looks fun, on paper it was a good idea. But the developers need to learn on alot more things.GRAPHICS This is a 2013 indie game, I wasn't expecting much for graphics, they're good but the only problem is that it feels like 720p (I played on 1920x1080 16:10), the rest of the graphic options don't exist, don't really mind that as the game doesn't have that much visual requirements. GAMEPLAY Offline is ok, the bots are very weird though.You can select difficulty (1-7) , at 1 they wont do anything except hit the ball once, 2 they're VERY difficult, like how does one play offline without getting frustrated trying to find the "medium" difficulty.Online is unplayable, I've realised that it is a bug which you can fix by restarting the game which is false for some users, but either way the developers should focus on fixing glitches, not hoping the community could do something. MENU LAYOUT My favourite part about this, the menu layout is something.You know how there was that kid in class who did everything the totally opposite way? That's this menu, when you click on "Back" (which is obnoxiously big) it has a chance of EXITING THE GAME. There is an exit button which appears where the back button does, but even mid game if you go into options, press back you won't simply leave the menu (even though you have chances of leaving the menu and staying in game) you won't get kicked out the game and back into the menu because the game thinks you somehow pressed quit, you quit the whole game. ONLY GOOD THINGS ABOUT THIS GAME Getting the glitched fixed and playing with friends. REQUEST Good idea on paper and would love to see any game dev do this better (Even on Garry's Mod you can probably pull off a better game tbh)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
												Lethal League is best described as "Battle Squash". Similar to the indoor sport, the object is to hit a ball as fast as you can so it will rebound towards your opponent, the only difference being that you are TRYING to hit them. It's the first fighting game I know of where player contact is actually very discouraged. The ball will gain speed with each hit, and with each character boasting their own unique 'special' moves, the game can get extremely tense very quickly. If you like fighting games, this translates very easily, and becomes basically hardcore tennis, where the object is to get the other player 'out' by hitting them with the ball. As you can imagine, with more speed, this becomes trickier, as the frame window where you can hit the ball is VERY small and requires a keen sense of timing. Very fun, very easy to get used to, and allowing up to four players at a time, which is very rare in the world of fighting games.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2015
												Lethal league is the right mix of casual multiplayer fun, and competetive, high-skill-cieling competition. The local multiplayer works to perfection, and the game is amazingly full, even with only six playable characters as of now. Whether you enjoy the zen, back-and-forth projectile control, or the frame-and-pixel-perfect, high-octane action, this game can appeal to just about any gamer. It's easy to pick up, the controls are solid and fully rebindable, and with access to online play and a single-player challenge mode, this is one game that's hard to put down. I highly recommend lethal league.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												Here is my review of Lethal League, (for lazy people scroll down to the bottom for the pro's and con's) and I do hope to play it more in the future. I hope you like or find my review helpful, and if I do mess up or misspell something please don't bash me with mean things. :)Lethal League is a sort of arcade game, you don't exactly 'need' friends to play it with, although it is a thousand times more fun with friends you know, as the game has 4-player lobbies to enjoy. The map's don't change anything except the background much, but it is nice to have some variety. As for the characters, they are very interesting and each have their own special abilities, which you can get by hitting the ball 4 times in a row. They very well aid in your victory. I highly recommend you play with a controller, and yes of course, it has controller support, you can play with the keyboard and be very good still. Although me personally I am much better with a controller. It has pixel-style graphics, which I quite enjoy. Overall I would recommend this to anyone with friends and spare time, I would get it when it is on sale, although it's good for the price too, although I ran into a few bugs, when I made the game full screen it wouldn't let me move the mouse out of a certain box, making the game unplayable, I later fixed it by messing with the properties of the game. The second bug I ran into was the online, after a match if you didn't click the ready button in order from which you joined it lagged all of the players out, leaving the host with a new lobby screen. Although those are the only 2 bugs I ran into.Pros: -Nice graphic style -Feels like an arcade game-4 Player co-op-Interesting characters-Fun gameplay-A great time waster-Not too pricey Cons:-Not many game modes-Not many tweaks to the matches, making each match feel like the last one-A few irritating bugs-Online is a little buggy.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
												Lethal League stands as one of my go-to games for friends that love the feel of fighting games, but hate the complicated inputs. I can't express to you how simple this game is, but how it can be taken to an entire new level, given enough experience. It's not just hitting a ball back and forth: it's timing your hits, learning the geometry of where the ball will bounce, positioning to make sure your hit connects.Great with 4 players, truly amazing with two. Grab two copies, play with a friend. I promise you won't be disappointed if you're even slightly interested.

Get a couple controllers and friends and it's a garunteed good time.PROS+Incredible soundtrack (even though it's short)+Neat (if inconsistent) art style+Very percise controls (on keyboard or controller)+Percise and consistent hitboxes+Just plain fun+Barely any lag in online+Classic fighting game single player mode+Incredibly satisfying+One of those games that causes people to stand up from the couch and start screaming when the characters go all super sayain with the ball+Seriously,♥♥♥♥♥♥s intense+Cheap+I don't even like fighting games but Lethal League is super accessible CONS-Game balance is screwy, ditto matches are the only real way to have a balanced match-Not enough characters (only 6 at the time of writing)-Repeated voices get annoying-Barely any variation in the maps (they're all boxes, no platforms/pits)-AI players need work (agressive playstyles get destroyed by anything higher than 4)-Only 3 versus modes (free for all, team battle, and what's basically air hockey)7/10, worth even a non-sale price for fighting games and worth a sale buy for everyone who likes local versus games

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												I learned of this game from watching TotalBiscuit's "WTF is..." about it and to me it seemed like a hilarious game concept.Now after about 3 hours spent in in, getting myself to lv10 I feel I can write a review of my own.This game is Awesome xDIt might seem simple, and it is, but sometimes simple fun is better than overly complicated things. In this game you fight your opponents by hitting a ball at them and that's it, on the surface. It's basically an easy to learn and hard to master game.Each character of the 5 you (at least currently) have to choose from has their own abilities, for one they all have different jumps of varying height and I think their movement speed varies too but it might be the visuals tricking me. On top of that they all have different special attacks, one makes the ball warp through the arena wall and come out on the other side, one double swings at the ball to increase the speed by ridiculous amounts and so on. Making use of those skills correctly is what will set you apart from the rest in the end.The game has a singleplayer component but I don't see why you'd wanna play against AI opponents in a game like this.The netcode for the multiplayer seems quite good, but it you want a lag free game I still recommend just going 1 vs 1. From what I gathered it's not perfected for more players yet but it's still posible to play a 4 player free for all with no issues, but know that there might be disconnects or desyncs happening in those.The visuals aren't amazing but for this kind of game they work quite well. Not all games has to be super flashy 3D and stuff, if the game works better with a simple 2D look then that's the better choise in my opinion.The music for the game is great. I haven't heard a track in there that I wish wasn't playing, overall really good sound effects too.I personally recommend playing on a controller but I'm sure it works fine on keyboard too, all keys are cusomizable for your comfort.Scores for those who need them:Graphics - 7 - It fits the style of the game but I'd be lying if I gave it a higher score.Sound and Music - 8.5 - Overall great, but not quite enough to get me to want the soundtrack.Gameplay - 9.5 - For such a simple game it's amazingly fun, probably even more so if you have three friends to play with.Overall score - 8.4 - I recommend you get it, if you're hesistant wait for a sale :D

content:
Posted: September 3, 2014
												Do NOT buy unless you are SURE that your graphics card can handle Open GL 4.0, even if your graphics card is listed as minimum or recomended. Intel R Series 4 Mobile Chipset Family graphics cards, while listed as recomended are NOT able to run the game. The only way to check if your card can run Open GL 4.0 is to make sure your drivers are fully updated, then download GL Extensions Viewer 2.1.If you cannot run 4.0, do not buy this game. A few unlucky folks (Myself included) have already accidentally bought/been gifted the game without the ability to play thanks to this unfortunate circumstance. Team Reptile, please ofer refunds on this game, or find a way to make this game made up of PNGs and MP3s run on the cards you yourself say are "recomended"

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												In this game you have to do two things:1) Hit the ball to turn it into your colour.2) Don't get hit by a ball that isn't your colour.Sound boring? A factual description often is. Now, every time the ball is hit, it gains 1 Mph (or is it Kph), if you hit it with a charge attack the speed increase varies from 2 Mph to double the current speed, the balls top speed is 1000000 (million) Mph. Now all you need is 3 friends and skype and this game quicly becomes the most friendship breaking, laughter inducing swear-fest since mario kart introduced blue shells.Put simply, this game is lan party heaven, its quick, has characters with unique specials and each game can last as little as 3 seconds, nobody cares about winning and everyone cares about fleeing from the little ball of doom! It is just fun, nothing else.Players have 5 characters to choose from at present:Raptor (aka cockblock) - a baseball bat toting kid who can intercept a ball before you have even finished hitting it, causing an instant K.O for you and can rebound off walls. Special move - Spin attack - massive increase to ball speed.Switch (aka Chav-o-tron 5000) - A skateboarding 'dude' robot who can skate on the roof (because reasons) and long reach to allow better reversal timing. Special move - Kickflip - double jump to reverse the ball in the direction it came from at double speed, oh so irritating.Candyman (aka DUDE! wtf is that!) - a cross eyed emoji that has possessed a ringmaster and stolen an old war vets cane who can jump high and float, peach style. Special move - it came from...behind! - turn the ball into a pac-man wannabee that can pass through walls and come out the opposite wall at the same speed and angle.Sonata (aka token) - The games only female, she carries a speaker modified into a two handed warhammer and can double jump, that hammer allows to increase the ball speed better than others but is slow to wield. Special move - sonic boom, launch the ball and stop it for an instant 3 times, at each pause the direction of the ball can be changed at will.Latch (aka Op POS) - A Beats wearing crocodile with a mecha tail that can latch (haha get it?) to a wall for as long as he wishes, slow attacks but second only to Sonata in strength - Special move - Don't be that guy - Eat the ball and carry it for 2 seconds before spitting it back out in the direction you choose, you can move normally while you have the ball and release it inside people for guaranteed K.O and loss of friends.~Round up~Story - N/A - there is a challenge mode with a boss, but thats not why anyone bought this gameGraphics - 9 - A comic book/graffiti style of cell shading that really fits the game.Sound - 7 - the music is fitting if not to my taste but the ball impact sounds soon drown that out, pro tip, turn volume to 50% before playing, seriously, that ♥♥♥♥ is LOUD!Gameplay - 10 - fast, fun and always entertaining.Overall - 9 - Don't play online, people are too good. As a game to play with friends over, this is a must, even if just to get people in the mood. add it to your wishlist. I SAID NOW!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												NOTE: This review was made during the current build of 8/24/16Lethal League is a 2D unique fighting game that has several similarities to other fighting games and even non-fighters. and has a unique gameplay style consisting of a single dodgeball that can be comboed. Other than that gameplay mechanic, the game itself is quite similar to Super Smash Bros. since the character moveset functions identical to it and the percentage/launch speed goes to the ball instead of the player, and the Stock/Time mechanic is still there, but instead uses rounds similar to other fighting games like Mortal Kombat or Street Fighter. The game has a special bar that functions like the PlayStation All-Stars Battle Royale one since it increases while doing direct hits. The small but varied roster consists of iconic characters with there own unique gameplay styles and special moves. Maps are all very similar but have different height and width, but no real stage hazards. The soundtrack is a love/hate thing and is really just based on your taste of music. The art-style is nothing special and unique, but combined with the soundtrack, it feels like playing a fighting game based off of Jet Set Radio. However, the lack of content in this game is not really worth the price considering the low ammount of characters, stages, and things to unlock in this game. Overall, this is a peculiar but decent indie fighting game that should be bought when on sale, because of it being a bit overpriced for what it's worth.Verdict: 7/10 "...a peculiar but decent indie fighting game that should be bought when on sale..."

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												A simple premise, a very fun game. Lethal League puts you in control of one of multiple fun characters, playing a mix of dodgeball / squash against others. Expect essentialy a multiplayer game... single-player is available in the form of challenges, but it falls quite short of the game's true value (which resides in PvP). Choices go from simple 1 vs 1 matches, to all-out 2 vs 2 team fights.Very fast-paced, Lethal League plays just like a console fighting game, button-mashing included! You'll have to be precise in hitting the ball, while pulling serious acrobatics to avoid being hit. Each character has its own style and personality, making it fun to test them out. Also, special moves provide you with flashy high-powered attacks, sure to impress (or more accurately depress, if successful) your buddies.As a personal opinion, the game is best played locally against friends, something which will likely result in a lot of fun & mayhem. There is of course the option to play on public servers, but it can take a while to find a match, especially with a good connection (with lag and connection issues being commonly reported problems).

content:
Posted: July 25, 2015
												Lethal league is the right mix of casual multiplayer fun, and competetive, high-skill-cieling competition. The local multiplayer works to perfection, and the game is amazingly full, even with only six playable characters as of now. Whether you enjoy the zen, back-and-forth projectile control, or the frame-and-pixel-perfect, high-octane action, this game can appeal to just about any gamer. It's easy to pick up, the controls are solid and fully rebindable, and with access to online play and a single-player challenge mode, this is one game that's hard to put down. I highly recommend lethal league.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												Here is my review of Lethal League, (for lazy people scroll down to the bottom for the pro's and con's) and I do hope to play it more in the future. I hope you like or find my review helpful, and if I do mess up or misspell something please don't bash me with mean things. :)Lethal League is a sort of arcade game, you don't exactly 'need' friends to play it with, although it is a thousand times more fun with friends you know, as the game has 4-player lobbies to enjoy. The map's don't change anything except the background much, but it is nice to have some variety. As for the characters, they are very interesting and each have their own special abilities, which you can get by hitting the ball 4 times in a row. They very well aid in your victory. I highly recommend you play with a controller, and yes of course, it has controller support, you can play with the keyboard and be very good still. Although me personally I am much better with a controller. It has pixel-style graphics, which I quite enjoy. Overall I would recommend this to anyone with friends and spare time, I would get it when it is on sale, although it's good for the price too, although I ran into a few bugs, when I made the game full screen it wouldn't let me move the mouse out of a certain box, making the game unplayable, I later fixed it by messing with the properties of the game. The second bug I ran into was the online, after a match if you didn't click the ready button in order from which you joined it lagged all of the players out, leaving the host with a new lobby screen. Although those are the only 2 bugs I ran into.Pros: -Nice graphic style -Feels like an arcade game-4 Player co-op-Interesting characters-Fun gameplay-A great time waster-Not too pricey Cons:-Not many game modes-Not many tweaks to the matches, making each match feel like the last one-A few irritating bugs-Online is a little buggy.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												    Although, at the current time I don't have much play time. (As of 12/31/14 I have 0.6 hours of gameplay) It didn't take me much to realize that this game, IS FREAKING AWESOME. I MEAN WITH ALL THE HIGH SPEED BALLS AND THE KICKIN' MUSIC. Oh, excuse me.    Anywho, the object of the game is to eliminate your opponent with a dodgeball that gains speed as you hit it a repetitive amount of times. You can charge up each shot by holding down the Z key (default key). You can play in either online mode or against bots, if you choose to face the bots you can increase their levels of difficulty. The maximum difficulty is 7. There are also "flavors" you can collect for each character as you level up in the game.    Overall, the game from my current view and experience with the game, I would recommend it for anyone. Whether you are a casual or competitive player.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 5, 2016
												Lethal League is easily my favorite indie game of all time. It mixes an excellent blend of skill and experience into a game that is deceptively simple looking. Getting better at the game gives you a great sense of accomplishment as you go from helplessly spamming the swing key in your early days, to predicting the angle in which the ball will bounce off the walls and positioning yourself to intercept it before it even leaves your opponent's swing. Supported by a tight and friendly community, people can ask for practice or advice from people with far more experience than them.The only downside of the game is the cost and player count, which are not mutually exclusive. While you can still find players, it takes a few minutes rather than a few seconds from the glory days of the game. This can potentially make it harder for new players to get in, as they may have to choose whether to continue to play against someone who destroys them or potentially wait for 5+ minutes in a queue. It can be hard to justify a $14 purchase on a game where getting a fair, fast match isn't guaranteed. However, the game goes on sale fairly often. Despite these risks, I think that a purchase of Lethal League is one that somebody with a competetive spirit owes themselves. Even if you cannot find a game using matchmaking, it shouldn't be too hard to find someone willing to play in the multiple steam groups for the game. This game is legendary. Have fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
												Extremely simple to learn, yet highly addictive. Depending on how you're playing and who you're playing against, this can be a great game to just take out some aggression with and turn your brain off while enjoying some sweet jams; or it can be an intense game of 'stay away from the ball'. I find the single-player challenge mode, well, challenging, and it keeps me coming back. I have come very close to beating it but haven't yet. The real heart of this game, though, is in its multiplayer and that's where the real fun begins. Waiting to get into a match with strangers can be annoying, as sometimes it seems no one is actually online to play, but playing with friends you're guaranteed to have some laughs.The whole thing is topped off with lots of style. It's a fun, frantic, silly game that I think everyone can enjoy.

content:
Posted: May 22, 2015
												When it comes to fighting games, I'm not usually a huge fan. Lethal League brings a new and engaging twist to the idea: Instead of hitting each other with your fists, you hit a ball at them, and they can hit it back. It turns into a game of timing and skill, rather than just button mashing. A relatively easy concept to learn, but beyond that, there are plenty of ways you can go about out-balling your opponent. Very cool, and very fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												This is a strange mix of dodgeball with baseball and it is a very fun, competitive, game.Games may be played 1-on-1, 3 or 4 free for all, and 2-on-2.It is actually harder to master than one would expect, raising the competitive bar. Balance is akin to fightning games, with swings having a certain number of hit frames and recover frames. All characters have a special and parrying is possible (very few frames). Due to these mechanics, if you like fightning games you may like this one just for the balance itself. Each character has a different speed, hitting angle and style of jump.Can't say much more since the gameplay videos are pretty much explanatory. If it looks cool to you then you will probably like it.

												A great game to play with friends!Has a local and online modes, both are up to 4 players and are extremely fun!Really easy to learn the basics, but getting the timing right is not that easy (well, for me at least. It's really great, too.I don't think I have anything bad to say about this game, but who knows what's wrong with it. I'm just writing this to say, that yes, this game is good in every aspect from my point of view. Try not to just count on one review, and go through videos, more reviews etc. to know if you really want it.

Posted: April 17, 2016
												I enjoyed my time playing Lethal League, especially the local multiplayer. I'd reccommend it to anyone who enjoys competitive local multiplayer (Ex: worms, leiro, etc). My only problem with the game is its fps. When I first got the game, it ran amazingly well on my horrible PC, at a constant 60 fps. No hiccups or anything. But after leaving it to gather dust in my library for a few months, I decided I wanted to go back to it. But I booted up the game and, no matter what graphics settings it was set to, the game only ran at a maximum of 25 fps. Other than that, the game is great. By the way, if you happen to have a fix for the fps problem, it'd be greatly appreciated.EDIT: fps problem is completely fixed now for some reason.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 9, 2015
												This game is the most fun I have had in 1 sitting for a long whileBefore going into detail notes: - I played this with a only a PS2 style controller so far- The Mac and Linux versions of this game are in beta and currently available to everyone who opts into it from the game properties menuNow assuming you understand the basic mechanics of hit the other player with the ball but don’t get hitHere are some keypoints of the gameBall tagging-You cannot be hit by the ball if you hit it last (It will be highlighted in your team/player color) ^ this also might cause confusion if you switch around player slots allot or just use to the defaultRed color given to Player 1(This mechanic can be turn off but it might lead all sorts of weirdness since you now have to watch out for your own ball)You have 3 basic attacks, 1 character specific special attack and 1 hidden protection mechanism when hitting a ballBasics:-Basic hit: you hit the ball (duh). You increase the ball speed by one and most importantly while its being hit you can control the direction you want the ball to travel inCharge attacksNote: Hold down the button to charge your attack to increase the ball speed when hit (can only be double its speed + you are a sitting duck while doing this)-Power attack/Smash attack: same key as basic attack but with a catch, to achieve this you need to be midair and hold down a directional button of left, right and down Note: you cannot hit the ball going through you unless its taged as your ball (don’t be do something silly)]Note: This and charge attack doubles the ball current speed-Blunt: Rips the ball of most of all its momentum and makes it travel upwards at the speed of anybody who tosses a ball moderately into the air to catch it again. Notes: Tags the balls as your ownKey component to mess up the pacing for your own benefitYOU CAN CONTROL THE DIRECTION THE BALL FLIES TOWARDSThe ball will resume full speed when it hits the ground but will only travel in a up and down motionONLY use this when you have an opening due to the other players can take the ball for themselves while its midair-HIDDEN PROTECTION THINGParrying: When you are hit lag (when time freezes while hitting the ball) you can press the blunt button to create a parry which can stun your enemy players who attempt to hit the ball while you use a parry. More on it here (Its not in the tutorial) 


YouTube™ Video: Lethal League (Advance Tech Breakdown) -  Parrying 

			Views: 3,441		

			A brief yet full explanation about how to stop aggressive players hitting your ball when you just got it. Take this technique to heart and you'll be playing some serious mind games against aggressive...		

--> I’m not going to spoil the character specific attacks for you because its more fun to find it out for yourself and see how it tie into the characters personality <--       What are the other actions you have availible -Jump – You can control your jump height-Taunt – 2 types Taunts, Press and release taunt = Gesture + VO taunt (Can be charge because why not)Direction key + tap of the taunt key = Worded messageUp= WowDown = Bring itLeft = OpsRight = NiceIf you want to learn more about the mechanics this guide will be more than enough to suit your needs 


From Newbie to Baller: A Technical Guide to Lethal League 
A Guide for Lethal League
By: Peter K. Rosenthal

			This is your one stop shop to learn the basic and technical aspects of Lethal League. Give it a read and you will be kicking butt online in no time.		


GraphicsThe game is admittedly lack luster and the characters are kind of generic but it holds up for what it doingSoundtrack/OST: Its very “flat-headed” electric music. Not much going up, not much going down.Just everything being cool and casual Example: 


YouTube™ Video: Lethal League OST - Ordinary Days 

			Views: 321,667		

			Great soundtrack, may upload the rest. I don't own this song. Klaus Veen - Ordinary Days		

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4YasRoOFQuYPlaylist for the OST https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFeuvN1IQa_qei1GZQ-tPvaPmAN5Z-R3rOnline play : I haven’t touch it yet due to not having much interest with playing with random sub its there and fully functional (Not sure if online supports bots)Offline play: To set the point crystal clear, the AI in this game is very competent (even on low levels)2 Types of modes to play in Verses and ChallengeVerses: This is where you and your peers duke it out in the battle arena, very quick loading between matches and 3 game modes availableFree for all – Set stocks or time limited, last one on or the biggest MVP winsTeams – Same as before but you can have a buddy of human/machine or you can have a 3v1, it’s up to youStrikers – You’re playing soccer with a baseball, you cannot accidentally score for the enemy team and the targets on each side takes up a decent part of the wallChallenge mode: I would call this alternative training or the game’s “story mode”, in layman terms, you pick your characters and go up against a certain number of progressionaly harder foes with a limited amount of continuesConclusionI would recommended this game to casual as well as veterans mostly due to its “easy to pick up but hard to master” natureAlso this game IMO will be great for parties or if you have friends over and you want to create scene where people are cheering on how intense the game is becomingSorry but I haven’t proof read this review. I’ll maybe do it latter but atm I just want to get it out of the way and off my list of things to do

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												Lethal League is unique, as far as I’m aware. It is, at heart, a fighting game that got confused somewhere along the line and wondered what it would be like if it was Pong. There are a set of characters, each with a unique move set, and their sole method of attack is manipulating a ball so that it hits their opponent. Every hit of the ball makes it faster and, thus, harder to avoid or hit back. Each player has a set of lives, one of which is lost each time they are knocked out by the ball. Once your life counter hits zero, you’re out, until only one player (or team) remains.You can read the full review here![spiritoftherobot.wordpress.com]

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												This is a strange mix of dodgeball with baseball and it is a very fun, competitive, game.Games may be played 1-on-1, 3 or 4 free for all, and 2-on-2.It is actually harder to master than one would expect, raising the competitive bar. Balance is akin to fightning games, with swings having a certain number of hit frames and recover frames. All characters have a special and parrying is possible (very few frames). Due to these mechanics, if you like fightning games you may like this one just for the balance itself. Each character has a different speed, hitting angle and style of jump.Can't say much more since the gameplay videos are pretty much explanatory. If it looks cool to you then you will probably like it.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2015
												A great game to play with friends!Has a local and online modes, both are up to 4 players and are extremely fun!Really easy to learn the basics, but getting the timing right is not that easy (well, for me at least. And I'm not that good with games anyways, so don't count on that bit too much.)Singleplayer has a challenge mode where you go through a line of opponents. It's really great, too.I don't think I have anything bad to say about this game, but who knows what's wrong with it. I'm just writing this to say, that yes, this game is good in every aspect from my point of view. Try not to just count on one review, and go through videos, more reviews etc. to know if you really want it.

Posted: January 14, 2016
												One of the most original fighting games I've ever played.Simple to pick up yet deep in it's mechanics to be a contender with any other game in this genre.Immediately found its way into my regular rotation of fighting games when friends are over for fight nights.Plus, with steam library sharing as liberal as it is AND this games tiny install size and low system requirements you can pretty much get a match going anywhere you have access to a computer.Highly recommend this for anyone looking for another game that lets you relive the glory days of sitting on a couch next to your competitor smack talking and laughing the night away.I know how pretentious that sounds, but this game is so genuinely enjoyable that I'm 100% sincere in saying it.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												Super fun, whacky take on a blend of pong and 2D fighting. Great competition online and indescribably hype playing playing 4 players local too!I didn't have much issue with lag or anything like that online.The controls are simple, but, in a similar way to Smash Bros, the mastery of those controls can go on and on. You can really become an expert at your movement and positioning to set yourself apart from the other players. It's not all just goofy, non-sensical mayhem.The music is great; coherent with the cel-shaded art style.All-around, a very cleanly polished game in terms of art and mechanics, that ultimately provides a thrilling experience.

												I still cannot believe how quickly this game became such a competitive sport between me and my group of friends. While this game may appear simplistic at first, there's actually a ridiculous amount of depth and strategy to the gameplay. Timing, ball speed, bunting, faking, clashing, differences between upswings and downswings, each character's speed, jump height, hit box, swing box, special move, hit angle, and wall manuevering. If you wanna have a good time with your friends, then play this game. However, I highly recommend controllers
